proj78.xml
Class XmlUtility

java.lang.Object
  proj78.xml.XmlUtility

public final class XmlUtility
extends java.lang.Object

Contains various static utility methods that are used throughout the DOM.

Note that although this class is publicly accessible, it is meant primarily for internal use.

Author:
K.A., copyright (c) 2008

Method Detail

isNameChar

public static boolean isNameChar(char ch,
                                 boolean initialChar)
Determines whether the specified character can be used in an XML name.

Parameters:
ch - the character to evaluate.
initialChar - indicates whether it is the first character in the name.
Returns:
true if the specified character is an XML name character, false otherwise.
See Also:
isValidName(java.lang.String)

isValidName

public static boolean isValidName(java.lang.String str)
Determines whether the specified string contains a valid XML name.

An XML name must start with a letter or an underscore and may contain only letters, digits, underscores, hyphens, periods and (at most a single) colon.

Parameters:
str - the string to evaluate.
Returns:
true if the specified string contains a valid XML name, false otherwise.
See Also:
isNameChar(char, boolean)

isQuoteChar

public static boolean isQuoteChar(char ch)
Determines whether the specified character is a quote character.

Parameters:
ch - the character to evaluate.
Returns:
true if the specified character is either a single or a double quote, false otherwise.

isWhitespaceChar

public static boolean isWhitespaceChar(char ch)
Determines whether the specified character is considered whitespace in XML.

XML whitespace characters are:

  • spaces (' ')
  • carrage returns ('\r')
  • line feeds ('\n') and
  • horizontal tabs ('\t')

Parameters:
ch - the character to evaluate.
Returns:
true if the specified character is an XML whitespace character, false otherwise.
See Also:
isWhitespace(java.lang.String)

isWhitespace

public static boolean isWhitespace(java.lang.String str)
Determines whether the specified string consists entirely of XML whitespace.

Parameters:
str - the string to evaluate.
Returns:
true if the specified string is made up of XML whitespace characters, false otherwise.
See Also:
isWhitespaceChar(char)

isEntityReference

public static boolean isEntityReference(java.lang.String str)
Determines whether the specified string contains an entity reference.

Parameters:
str - the string to evaluate.
Returns:
true if the specified string contains either a predefined XML entity reference or a (possibly numeric) character reference, false otherwise.
